item.title: A resolution honoring the life and legacy of the Honorable Donald M. Payne.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S1493; text as passed Senate: CR S1493; text of measure as introduced: CR S1462-1463)

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection. (text: CR H1179)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.(text: CR H1179)
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H1179)

summary.text:
Declares that the House of Representatives has heard with profound sorrow of the death of the Honorable Donald M. Payne, a Representative from New Jersey.

Declares that when the House adjourns on March 6, 2012, it stand adjourned as a further mark of respect to the memory of the deceased.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Declares that the House of Representatives has heard with profound sorrow of the death of the Honorable Donald M. Payne, a Representative from New Jersey.

Declares that when the House adjourns on March 6, 2012, it stand adjourned as a further mark of respect to the memory of the deceased.

bill.title: Expressing the condolences of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable Donald M. Payne, a Representative from the State of New Jersey.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
